com.cinchapi.concourse.db

Class Value

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cinchapi.concourse.db.Value
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteSized, Persistable, java.lang.Comparable<Value>

    public final class Value
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Value>, Persistable

    An immutable typed quantity that is contained within a Cell. Both naturally sortable in descending order by timestamp and logically sortable in ascending order by quantity( regardless of type). This is the most basic element of data in Concourse. A single value cannot be larger than 2GB.

    1 - No two values can have the same timestamp

    Storage Requirements

    Each value requires at least 16 bytes of space. Additional space requirements are as follows:
    • BOOLEAN requires an additional 1 byte
    • DOUBLE requires an additional 8 bytes
    • FLOAT requires an additional 4 bytes
    • INTEGER requires an additional 4 bytes
    • LONG requires an additional 8 bytes
    • RELATION requires an additional 8 bytes
    • STRING requires an additional 1-4 bytes for every character (uses UTF-8 encoding)

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    jnelson

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Value o)
        Natural comparison where the value with the larger timestamp is less than the other. This enables sorting by timestamp in descending order. This method correctly accounts for comparing a forStorage value to a notForStorage one.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Value>

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Value o,
            boolean logically)
        Determine if the comparison to o should be done naturally or logically.
        Parameters:
        o -
        logically - if true the value based comparison occurs, otherwise based on timestamp/equality
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.

        public long getTimestamp()

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(java.nio.channels.FileChannel channel)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Persistable
        Write the object to a writable channel. This method should acquire a lock over the region from the channels current position plus the ByteSized.size() of the value. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the channel is in the correct position before and after this method has run. In general, call Persistable.Writer.write(Persistable, FileChannel) from this method.
        Specified by:
        writeTo in interface Persistable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Persistable.Writer#write(Persistable, FileChannel)}
